page.title: 18THE OLD MILL,HILTON
page.content: In 1085 there were two mills in Hilton One was probably on the site of the present mill.Throughout the 19th Cent. it was operating as a corn mill- grinding corn and making dog biscuits. The mill closed down in the 1930's and after the water wheels were removed during World War Two, it stood empty for over 40 years.It is now in use again as a manufacturing establishment A local business man reopened it in December 1980 after massive repairs and cleaning up. Now after 4 and a half years the firm employs 7 people fulltime and 12 others part time, as well as using outworkers producing display equipment, wireformed goods and printing balloons. Instead of being left to decay the mill is now proving to be a local source of industry and is providing jobs for local people.
